revised_title: Electrical Methods for Studying the Mammalian Nervous System
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using electrical methods to study the mammalian nervous system, focusing on the localization of functions and the effects of electrical changes in the spinal cord. They discovered that the electrical state of nerve fibers changes when excited, and they used this to study the connections between the cortex and the spinal cord. Their findings provided insights into the physiology of the spinal cord and its relation to higher centers and peripheral nerves.
